clinical_study.brief_title: Levetiracetam Treatment in Adult Subjects With Parkinson's Disease Experiencing Troublesome Dyskinesias
clinical_study.official_title: A Therapeutic Exploratory, Single Arm, Multicenter Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Levetiracetam up to 4000 mg/Day (500mg Oral Tablets) on Levodopa Induced Dyskinesias in Adults With Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 41-week trial composed of two consecutive parts (Part A, 14 weeks and optional Part B, 27 weeks) to evaluate the efficacy of levetiracetam in controlling levodopa induced dyskinesias in adults with Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease, without negative impact on the benefit on the motor function of the antiparkinsonian treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the efficacy of levetiracetam in controlling levodopa induced dyskinesias in adults with Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease by assessing the reduction in mean duration of dyskinesias during "on" period at 10-week

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction in mean duration of dyskinesias per day at 9 month;Safety

clinical_study.keyword: Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease, levodopa induced dyskinesia,
